profile_positions.description:
Guided and implemented multi-country, multi-year, interdisciplinary programme on development and promotion of scaled implementation of innovative locally-grounded land tool in practice, policy, planning at global, regional, national, local scales, for enhanced land rights, access to land for the poor, women, marginalized groups just, inclusive and sustainable land use and protection of natural resources. Executed n partnership with GLTN/UN-Habitat. In collaboration with grassroots organisations, civil society, governments, knowledge institutes/universities, private sector, multi-lateral and bi-lateral agencies.
• Developed concept note on vision, principles and framework (2013-2014).
• Spearheaded documentation 4 international case studies in diverse contexts to refine and pilot test tool and disseminate best practices (2013-2016).
• Developed various written outputs, incl. 4 case study reports; overarching report; overarching report; final report; World Bank Land and Poverty Conference Papers 2015 and 2016; Conference on Land Policy in Africa Paper 2017.
• Co-chaired and facilitated dialogue at multi-stakeholder Expert Group Meeting (Washington DC, 03-2016), GLTN Validation Workshop (Nairobi, 12-2016), and GLTN Partners Meeting (Nairobi, 11-2015).
• Presented World Bank Land and Poverty Conference Paper 2016 (Washington DC, 03-2016).
• Represented ITC during field missions and in meetings with UN-Habitat/GLTN.
• Principal-authored International Tool Publication, incl. best practice chapter that showcases tool application by Maasai Women Development Organisation under Tanzania Village Land Act (10/2017-03/2018).
• Accelerated uptake innovative approach through simultaneous implementation of pilot projects (2013-2016) and follow-up projects worldwide (2016-2019).
• Published 2 international scientific journal articles for rural and (peri-) urban contexts.
• Provided invited lecture for Master Land Management, at ITC/ University of Twente (26/11/2018).
profile_positions.title: Principal Consultant to UN-Habitat/GLTN on Innovative Land Tool Development and Implementation

profile_positions.description:
Led programme coordination of and technical assistance to KW-LV WatSan P5b AMC (€ 22m, KFW, AFD, EIB, EU-AITF financed), supported by National Water and Sewerage Corporation, on affordable and improved water, sanitation, hygiene services in 22 informal settlements for improved health, environmental sustainability, climate resilience in Kampala. Supervised programme financial management. Designed and implemented MEL framework. Coordinated consortium of 4 international and local partners. Led and mentored Technical Assistance team of 12 consultants (6 international, 6 local LTEs).
• Developed scoping study for innovative sustainable self-financing financing mechanism of city-wide Sanitation Levy Fund.
• Developed feasibility study on options smart solar pre-paid communal water metering systems for procurement 2,500 units.
• Improved access to affordable safe drinking water for 400,000 people.
• Assessed capacity for alternative organisation and HR models Urban Pro-Poor Services at NWSC HQ, Kampala Water, Branch levels.
• Improved access to sanitation for 22,000 pupils at 22 public primary schools,1,000 people at 6 KCCA toilets, 2,000 people at 2 simplified sewerage pilots.
• Promoted inclusive and sustainable city-wide sanitation through development standards for improved and affordable private onsite sanitation.
• Supported design and implementation faecal sludge management cycle to boost environmental sustainability (wetlands preservation), climate resilience (waste prevention, treatment, recycling, reuse), job creation.
• Implemented sanitation marketing/hygiene promotion strategy, cascade training of trainers, public forums with political leadership and CHWs in 5 divisions, that raised adequate sanitation measures for 250,000 slum dwellers.
• Enhanced institutional coherence: i) established MoU NWSC, KCCA, NEMA ;aligned informal and formal institutions; iii) fostered synergies with parallel programmes.
• Ensured compliance with Environmental & Social Safeguards.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader TA/Institutional Development Expert Kampala Water-Lake Victoria WatSan Programme P5b AMC

profile_positions.description:
Conducted comprehensive capacity assessment of Uganda Land Sector at national, regional and local levels, supported by the Ministry of Lands, Housing and Urban Development, to support scaled implementation of progressive National Land Policy for enhanced equitable, inclusive and sustainable land governance. land development and socio-economic growth.

• Assessed existing institutional and technical capacity and identified gaps and recommendations for national/local government, civil society, communities, private sector, universities for improved inclusive land governance and land rights administration in terms of: i) human and technical capacities and resources in land administration, land registration; land dispute/conflict resolution; ii) land rights administration institutions; iii) land rights administration formal systems and informal systems; iv) international best practices of land administration system with formalized customary tenure (Namibia; Malawi).
• Provided Strategic Roadmap with recommendations for improved performance that was discussed in multi-stakeholder consultative workshop with key national/local government, civil society, communities, private sector, universities and donor agencies.
• Resulted in proposals to Public Service for increased staff, to Parliament for approval establishment Land Registration Authority, and proposal to allocate generated funds from land sector to strengthen land administration services.
profile_positions.title: Senior Expert Capacity Assessment Uganda Land Sector to Support Implementation National Land Policy

profile_positions.description:
Led programme coordination of and technical assistance to KISIP ($165m, World Bank, AFD, SIDA financed), supported by Ministry of Land, Housing & Urban Development. Coordinated and supported implementation 5-year urban informal settlement development action plan for improved living conditions in 15 cities. Supervised programme financial management. Designed and implemented M&E framework. Coordinated consortium of 2 international and local partners. Led and mentored Technical Assistance team of 6 consultants and 120 STE months.

• Developed and implemented inclusive and sustainable urban informal settlement development action plans, aligned with city development plans.
• Accelerated climate resilient urban infrastructure investment and at 60% (incl. water, sanitation, energy, roads, footpaths, high masts, housing) and improved access to infrastructure services for 250,000 people in 2014-2015.
• Enhanced access to land tenure security for 8,500 people through provision letters of allotment and titles in 2014-2015.
• Planned for future urban growth by developing options for delivery infrastructure services, land, affordable housing that prevent informal settlement formation.
• Ensured compliance with Environmental and Social Safeguards.
• Strengthened institutions and built capacity to enable accelerated implementation, incl.: comprehensive capacity and institutional assessment and training and capacity development programme at national, county, settlement levels.
• Enhanced institutional alignment, incl. i) developed strategies for continued performance in light of constitutional restructuring local and national government and establishment National Land Commission; ii) established KISIP county teams and multi-level governance systems; iii) aligned informal and formal institutions; v) built partnership agreements with ministries and (inter)national NGOs for accelerated technical review; vi) fostered synergies with 6 parallel programmes.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader TA/Institutional Development Expert, Kenya Informal Settlements Improvement Programme

profile_positions.location: Ethiopia, Amhara and Tigray National Regional States
profile_positions.description:
Led programme coordination of and technical assistance to ULGDP II (USD 48m, World Bank  financed), supported by Ministry of Urban Development, Construction & Housing, to establish Green Growth, Resilient, Well-Governed Cities and accomplish structural transformation towards inclusive economies in 18 cities and 2 regional states. Supervised programme financial management. Designed and implemented M&E system for cities’ performance. Coordinated consortium of 3 international and local partners. Led and mentored Technical Assistance team of 27 consultants (9 International LTEs/STEs and 18 Local LTEs).

• Assessed capacity of cities, regional, federal governments in institutional and service delivery performance related to grant disbursement-linked performance indicators.
• Supported development of inclusive and sustainable city action plans, capital investment plans, performance-based grant applications for 18 cities.
• Grew climate resilient urban infrastructure investment by ensuring compliance of all cities to minimum conditions DLI1 and score 60+% on minimum performance conditions DLI 2 & 3 (average:73%).
• Improved climate resilient infrastructure services delivery in water, sanitation, solid waste, roads drainage, built SSME facilities, urban parks and greenery, land services.
• Ensured compliance to Environmental and Social Safeguards.
• Leveraged capacity local, regional, federal government in institutional performance (incl. urban planning, land management, capital investment planning, participatory budgeting, local economic development) and service delivery performance (job creation, infrastructure, maintenance, value for money).
• Strengthened institutional relations, incl. i) established ULGDP core teams and improved multi-level governance systems; ii) aligned informal and formal institutions; iii) improved government accountability; iii) established regional multi-sector steering committees; iv) fostered synergies with 3 parallel programmes.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader/Senior Urban Local Government Expert, ULGDPII for Green, Resilient, Well-Governed Cities

profile_positions.description:
Guided and executed several innovative action-oriented research and capacity development programmes for equitable, inclusive and sustainable integrated and participatory urban transformation and territorial development in context of devolution to counties under the progressive rights-based Constitution of Kenya 2010 to protect basic rights and for marginalized and vulnerable groups, especially women and children, to claim their rights.

• Urban Innovations Project – Centre for Urban Research and Innovation, University of Nairobi, IDRC/Rockefeller Foundation (11/2012-09/2013)
- Co-guided and co-executed action-oriented research on citizen-led urban co-production of inclusive and sustainable integrated urban transformation in Nairobi’s informal settlements in the context of devolution to counties.
• Support to Policy Position Paper on National Slum Upgrading and Prevention Policy (NSUPP) – University Mtaani, Tangaza Institute, Catholic University of Eastern Africa & NGOs Pamoja Trust and Kutoka Network (06-10/2013)
• Capacity Development for Planning and Implementation of Affordable Housing – IHS Institute for Housing and Urban Development, Nuffic (09/2012-06/2013)
• Support to Development Technical Proposal Consultancy Services for Planning and Surveying – IHS Institute for Housing & Urban Development, Erasmus University Rotterdam & ARS Progetti (05-06/2013) 
- Developed technical proposal, methodology, workplan and team composition for World Bank financed project ‘Consultancy Services for Planning and Surveying in Nairobi, Mombasa, Embu and Thika, Kenya’.
• Research on Affordable and Sustainable Housing in the Urban Global South– Utrecht University & Free University Amsterdam (01/2012-12/2013; part-time)
• Final Evaluation Program Improving Food Security Vulnerable Urban Population Affected by Food Price Crisis – Solidarites International, EU (08-10/2011)
profile_positions.title: Senior Researcher on Fair, Inclusive, Sustainable Integrated Urban/Regional Spatial Development

profile_positions.description:
Executed interdisciplinary, mixed-methods research aimed at formulating conditions for sustainable impacts on services delivery, quality of life, influence, political rights of inclusive urban governance in Nairobi through ‘invited spaces’ offered by government and ‘claimed/hybrid spaces’ created by the urban poor from Nairobi’s informal settlements (NWO-WOTRO funded). Led and mentored team of 6 research assistants.
• Carried out 4 interrelated extensive comparative studies:
1) Comparative research on processes, transformation / hybridization, and impact of 3 inclusive city-wide governance networks in Nairobi.
2) Comparative research on processes and impact of 6 citizen-led hybrid initiatives for access to land and secure tenure by the urban poor moving from informal settlements to peri-urban areas.
3) Survey on impact of livelihood strategies urban poor based on developed multi-dimensional livelihood assets and vulnerability index and identification opportunities and constraints in alignment of informal and formal institutions.
4) Additional comparative research on processes and impact of citizen-led hybrid initiatives in solid waste management and their networks.
• Published 3 international scientific journal articles and 1 book (387 pp).
• Influenced global research, policy, planning and practice: i) Invited lecture for IHS Master Course on Adaptive and Pro-Active Housing Development Strategies (06/2011); ii) Key note for Amnesty International debate series on Amnesty’s shift in roles from Human to ESC Rights (11/2010).
